parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: The actions that this response plan takes at the beginning of an incident. (dict) --- The action that starts at the beginning of an incident. The response plan defines the action. ssmAutomation (dict) --- The Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the beginning of the incident. The automation document's name. documentVersion (string) --- The automation document's version to use when running. dynamicParameters (dict) --- The key-value pair to resolve dynamic parameter values when processing a Systems Manager Automation runbook. (string) --- (dict) --- The dynamic SSM parameter value. variable (string) --- Variable dynamic parameters. A parameter value is determined when an incident is created. parameters (dict) --- The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation document. (string) --- (list) --- (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation document will assume when running commands. targetAccount (string) --- The account that the automation document will be run in. This can be in either the management account or an application account.

nested_params.name: ssmAutomation
nested_params.description: The Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the beginning of the incident.

nested_params.name: documentVersion
nested_params.description: The automation document's version to use when running.

nested_params.name: dynamicParameters
nested_params.description: The key-value pair to resolve dynamic parameter values when processing a Systems Manager Automation runbook.

nested_params.name: variable
nested_params.description: Variable dynamic parameters. A parameter value is determined when an incident is created.

nested_params.name: parameters
nested_params.description: The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation document.

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation document will assume when running commands.

nested_params.name: targetAccount
nested_params.description: The account that the automation document will be run in. This can be in either the management account or an application account.

parameters.name: arn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.

parameters.name: chatChannel
parameters.description: The Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an incident. Use the empty structure to remove the chat channel from the response plan. chatbotSns (list) --- The Amazon SNS targets that Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident through the chat channel by using the Amazon SNS topics. (string) --- empty (dict) --- Used to remove the chat channel from an incident record or response plan.

nested_params.name: chatbotSns
nested_params.description: The Amazon SNS targets that Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident through the chat channel by using the Amazon SNS topics.

nested_params.name: empty
nested_params.description: Used to remove the chat channel from an incident record or response plan.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the specified details. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: engagements
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the contacts and escalation plans that the response plan engages during an incident. (string) ---

parameters.name: incidentTemplateImpact
parameters.description: Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites the impact provided by a response plan. 1 - Critical 2 - High 3 - Medium 4 - Low 5 - No Impact.

parameters.name: incidentTemplateNotificationTargets
parameters.description: The Amazon SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an incident. (dict) --- The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an incident. snsTopicArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.

nested_params.name: snsTopicArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.

parameters.name: incidentTemplateTags
parameters.description: Tags to assign to the template. When the StartIncident API action is called, Incident Manager assigns the tags specified in the template to the incident. To call this action, you must also have permission to call the TagResource API action for the incident record resource. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: integrations
parameters.description: Information about third-party services integrated into the response plan. (dict) --- Information about third-party services integrated into a response plan. pagerDutyConfiguration (dict) --- Information about the PagerDuty service where the response plan creates an incident. The name of the PagerDuty configuration. Details about the PagerDuty service associated with the configuration. The ID of the PagerDuty service that the response plan associates with an incident when it launches. The ID of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that stores your PagerDuty key, either a General Access REST API Key or User Token REST API Key, and other user credentials.

nested_params.name: pagerDutyConfiguration
nested_params.description: Information about the PagerDuty service where the response plan creates an incident.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the PagerDuty configuration.

nested_params.name: pagerDutyIncidentConfiguration
nested_params.description: Details about the PagerDuty service associated with the configuration.

nested_params.name: serviceId
nested_params.description: The ID of the PagerDuty service that the response plan associates with an incident when it launches.

nested_params.name: secretId
nested_params.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that stores your PagerDuty key, either a General Access REST API Key or User Token REST API Key, and other user credentials.
